newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine taxmen seeking $6 billion in court cases.
newsitem.headline: Argentine taxmen seeking $6 billion in court cases.

text.p: The Argentine government is pursuing court cases to recover tax payments totaling $6 billion, the head of the tax department said Wednesday.
"About half of the 400,000 court cases correspond to infractions of pension regulations," said tax chief Carlos Silvani.
He added that of the 17,000 largest businesses in the country, about 3,700 were being audited by the tax department.
